column5: Omg where did you read that INFJ Type 4s were the majority?? That‚Äôs what I am! I MUST dive into this further deep analysis on MYSELF

Based on this ‚Äúmost accurate description,‚Äù I am definitely an INFJ. I‚Äôve pretty consistently been typed as one and I would say 90% of the above statements were hallelujahs. The only that didn‚Äôt click was the detach me once, detach me twice one. I generally try to either be honest or just don‚Äôt say anything when it comes to justifying my decisions about people to their faces, even if it‚Äôs something negative like why I cut them off.

I must say the defensive tone of this post made me laugh a bit though. Seemed a bit undue. But the content was good and I always appreciate rigor in analysis. I think I‚Äôve been convinced. Although the ending was a bit of a knife twist‚Äîwe‚Äôre destined to be unhappy? Dannng it OP
Ooh, I would LOVE to go to Australia right about now. Nature and acai bowls and sunshine. Trade me!

Wait I‚Äôm shook‚Äîyes. INFJ 4w3 here. Didn‚Äôt think I related to this post at first because I am very measured/calm and I do not have rage issues in the least...but something struck a cord about the ‚Äúseething rage.‚Äù

I feel it specifically when I see the helpless or the vulnerable being preyed on. Girls/women and old people particularly. I saw a headline about the New Delhi bus rapists who were executed by the state recently, was reminded of the gory details of the crime again, and vehemently experienced bloodlust and satisfaction over the death penalty. Times like that, ‚Äúseething rage‚Äù is absolutely fitting. 

I have also over time channeled this general rage towards predatory men and rapists into boxing, which has become one of my favorite hobbies and preferred way to workout. I often find myself saying things like ‚ÄúI‚Äôd like to see them try‚Äù or ‚ÄúI would love to fight them.‚Äù I‚Äôm actually more of a ‚Äúflight‚Äù instinct when it comes down to it, but it‚Äôs only when I‚Äôve had time to think on the injustice/evil of it all that I get really mad. Never thought it was connected to INFJ tendencies!
What an amazing place to sit and watch the scenery go by. I am getting the urge to go to Paris just thinking about it.

LMAOOOOO as a New Yorker I can say I‚Äôm glad someone likes Times Square, because this INFJ avoids it like the plague (pun NOT intended). That‚Äôs the one place where I could not care to people watch at all haha.
Yessss. That sentence clicked for me: we like to understand the grand picture and how everything is connected.

Yes!! I absolutely love it. I‚Äôm a writer and very much an observer. That‚Äôs why even though I am very much a homebody introvert, this coronavirus is making me sad...because I can‚Äôt be out and about just observing city life, people watching, etc. 

Sometimes I don‚Äôt even feel like people are necessarily the focus of the activity. It‚Äôs more about a scene, a tapestry of moving parts, a microcosm, a vibe...being able to be a part of it but also be observing from the outside.

EDIT: I just realized something even creepier. I like to HOME WATCH. There is no way this doesn‚Äôt make me sound like a burglar or a stalker but I love looking at big apartment buildings at night from afar with all their little windows glowing with warm light‚Äîthinking about how many people‚Äôs lives are contained in that building and what each of them are doing at that time. When I‚Äôm walking down the street, I like to peek through the street-facing windows if they‚Äôre open and see what‚Äôs going on‚Äîobserve the pets staring out, the different choices of houseplants on the sill, anything at all. I chalk this up to my intense passion for home decor/homebodyness + the innate desire to observe and understand.
NEED TO TRY. Where did you find it?!

This is a very good point. I actually very much value my privacy and independence. I love my family but they are definitely dysfunctional. I would be able to quarantine effectively there and they are in great health. Still, they‚Äôre in their 50s. I‚Äôm leaning towards staying right now but it makes me nervous that it will get harder to leave as the weeks pass, which is why I‚Äôm questioning myself I guess.
LOLLLL I would love a detailed risk formula rn. I‚Äôm about to make the worlds biggest pro/con list

I moved here 8 months ago after graduating college. :) I do consider this my first home which is why I was reluctant to leave earlier, pardon my language. My decision now is more so motivated by the collapsing health system, not any lack of loyalty to the city.

It‚Äôs great that we are able to separate Asian Americans and the CCP. I would go a step further and say it‚Äôs not even an issue of particularly egregious Chinese governmental negligence. They made mistakes but every government is slow to respond. One could argue the US government also massively underestimated and downplayed the outbreak too in the past few weeks‚Äîcertainly the President‚Äôs communication, documented very clearly on Twitter, reflects that. 

My bigger point is that, if we‚Äôre going to address global politics at this point in the crisis, I think we need to be more surgical with our rejection of China‚Äôs authoritarian government, which I am completely on board with, and our analysis of its reaction to COVID-19. The WHO has repeatedly praised China for its swift response. They isolated the virus, sequenced it, shared it with the global health community, built two hospitals in under a month, and flattened the curve dramatically which, yes, helps us all. In the coming months, we would hope to be a China in terms of how they‚Äôve dealt with the virus, and not an Italy or Iran.

Pandemics are by nature a collectivist, ‚Äútragedy of the commons‚Äù issue. Thus the most utilitarian net positive outcome lends itself to governments that can act quickly and erect barriers to human movement, and a population that will comply. This isn‚Äôt politics or saying China is better or justified for it. It‚Äôs simply fact and structure. That is where I think we get tripped up, because we don‚Äôt feel good about China‚Äôs underlying political structure and its trade offs, and that can bleed into our objectivity when we address issues that desperately need good science and objectivity, like this pandemic.
Hahaha relatable! Try getting a self locking box for any trigger foods if needed. I have one and it‚Äôs nice just for mental relief.

Thank you! Makes me feel better haha. There‚Äôs definitely certain measures I can take to stock up on food but it‚Äôs a whole other thing to have huge drums of water in my tiny apt. In twenty years I‚Äôll have a huge underground bunker but we‚Äôre not there yet ;)

Me too! Started IF to address my binge eating and it‚Äôs really saved me. I‚Äôm only about a month in (brief disruption due to getting sick) but it‚Äôs even more important to me now that I‚Äôm quarantining. The kitchen is there all the time and old me would‚Äôve been out of my mind and jumping out of my skin without this to give me peace and calm. That‚Äôs what it is‚Äînot starvation. And in these times, it can be a matter of health and grave illness too, as my food stores will last so much longer without a binge. Thankful.

You‚Äôre right. Jesus, that‚Äôs a really tough position to be in. Thank you for sharing and being honest and raw with us. It‚Äôs crazy how this thing has changed our mindset. 

I‚Äôm doing really well with controlling my binging right now too because of this kick in the ass of, ‚ÄúFuck, I have a real potentially huge problem now if I don‚Äôt recover.‚Äù If I binge all my food within the week, that creates a health risk for me. I don‚Äôt purge so I‚Äôm lucky to only be dealing with half the problem, perhaps a milder form of ED. But gosh, stay safe and if you don‚Äôt hear it from anyone else, I‚Äôm really proud of you for doing the right thing to keep yourself healthy and safe and for thinking of the community like this.
As a deep charcuterie lover, this post made my heart sing. NICE WORK.

Hey all, OP here. Thank you for your insights. You guys echoed some beginnings of best practices I‚Äôve been thinking on, like buying dry staples and foods that need to be prepared. I‚Äôve also been inspired to think more categorically about my trigger foods (any dessert, peanut butter, chocolate, baked goods, cheese, meat, etc). It‚Äôs tempting to grab some snacks re: emotional eating, stress eating, and ‚Äúmorale food‚Äù in prepper terms (r/preppers wya), but I have to remember it‚Äôs just my brain trying to trick me into thinking this is good for me...again. In a strange way, do you guys ever think that binging behavior at one point was probably evolutionarily beneficial to our ancestors? And that coronavirus is the closest thing to replicating those past conditions of herd panic and scarcity that might be triggering the behavior yet again? Damn parabolic, indeed.

I will admit I went a bit crazy today and bought $150 worth of groceries‚Äîbut I feel it‚Äôs necessary to elaborate on the situation. I live in NYC and have been instructed to work from home for the next two weeks. I actually caught what I think is a cold last week, so I am extra paranoid about getting coronavirus now while my immune system is still struggling to recover. I‚Äôm otherwise a healthy 22 year old with no underlying issues, but frankly, we still know so little about the disease and I‚Äôd rather not risk it. Hence why I did cave and panic-buy. I did a mix of non-perishables (useful but not healthy) and fresh fruit and veg (mostly freezer friendly). I‚Äôm literally trying not to go out for the next two weeks so I bought a pack of digestives, some baking chocolate chips, and chocolate milk for the sweet tooth, fearing if that I cut myself off completely I‚Äôd break and go back outside for dessert. I‚Äôm going to lock the first two in my self locking container so I can‚Äôt get to them outside of my daily portion. The chocolate milk we‚Äôll just have to pray I can control myself around lol.

This is very true. If we really starve, we‚Äôll have other problems to worry about, like the collapse of transportation, our government, and plumbing/heating lol. I‚Äôm more so just worried about price gouging with food, especially in the dense urban location I live in, and taking a hit financially because I couldn‚Äôt control my eating. 

The question then becomes, diet or money! It‚Äôs so easy to buy into the panic and the logic of ‚Äúwhat‚Äôs the harm in being prepared?‚Äù But I keep on having to remember that for people like us, there IS a very real harm to having too much food around. :/

Glad to know I‚Äôm not alone. My binging actually got so bad that I went to a therapist to address it for the first time in my 22 years of life just a few weeks ago. I actually really started to turn things around through starting intermittent fasting. Had just completed three weeks of IF and was due for my second therapy session when coronavirus hit the US full in the face. Thanks for nothing coronavirus.

Love this insight (I‚Äôm OP). Yeah, I‚Äôve noticed before that buying non-instant or non-snackable foods does help. However, my concern is sometimes if I don‚Äôt buy any snacks at all, I end up making stuff‚Äîlike mug cakes, crepes, pancakes, very carb heavy items‚Äîand binging all of that, which can be just as calorific. My solve for THAT was to just not buy flour and make baked goods anymore, but in a time of stockpiling it naturally is a key staple and also sometimes I want to make things like zucchini fritters and I need to buy flour...

It just gets so frustrating and humiliating sometimes. I feel like I‚Äôm trying to trick some kind of monkey (my binging brain) into a cage (not binging) and I‚Äôm pretzeling myself over something that ‚Äúnormal‚Äù people don‚Äôt even blink twice about. Thanks for making me feel less alone though, everyone.
Oh lord. So sorry for the hellish month you‚Äôve been going through, but also, super jealous of your 200 acres! I have access to a piece of concrete outside my NYC high rise. It‚Äôs...not ideal.

Great, thanks! Looking for good podcasts to put on while I‚Äôm quarantine-cleaning around the apartment. Also this is terrible but I find him kinda attractive...a podcast will be less distracting. Ha!

I know. The concept of the gym has always vaguely boggled me. Maybe I‚Äôm the only one who thinks like an efficiency obsessed weirdo, but it seems kind of a shame to see all this energy to go waste. Maybe instead of a stationary bike, bike outside and deliver some Doordash orders? Instead of running on a normal treadmill, run on one that generates clean energy? Maybe instead of lifting weights, help people move furniture? Getting super off topic now but yeah...we are definitely over engineering what nature knows best, in general. Smh.

Whoaaa this is so cool. I read the Blue Zone diet and it actually sounds very similar to the diet I‚Äôm aiming for right now and have largely adapted (save for the sin of my sweet tooth!). Loving how resourceful everyone is, thanks!
Me too! :)

Hmmmm ok that changes things a bit then. You may opt to go home and that wouldn‚Äôt be terrible. I‚Äôd really try to convince your old man to stay home though, if not for his safety, than everyone else‚Äôs :/ Good luck fam!
Omg I just discovered his page. When he pulled out the 2x2 the consultant in me was like (‚úø ‚óï‚Äø‚óï) hahahah. Thank you!

So much wisdom, especially #4. Thank you! I also thought on it a bit and I think a large part of my turmoil comes from that old habit of emotional eating in times of stress (aka now). It‚Äôs easy to justify buying snacks and comfort foods in times of ‚Äúquarantine‚Äù or ‚Äúpandemic.‚Äù But hopefully we shall emerge from this trainwreck skinny, disciplined goddesses. Godspeed!

Yeah if you have grandparents at home I would say DON‚ÄôT go. I also just read and watched a stat that said 75-80% of transmissions were within family units during the outbreak in China, which makes sense. The best we can do as New York City residents is self quarantine.

Yeah, debating going back to Michigan or not. Obviously bigger house and home cooking there, but I‚Äôm worried about transmitting to my parents. I‚Äôm 22 and they‚Äôre in good health, no underlying issues for any of us, but still. Thoughts?

First post in this group. I‚Äôve always had prepper instincts but I‚Äôm 22 and live in New York City in a predictably tiny ass apartment, so I‚Äôm kind of just weighing my options right now as to what to do. I probably have two weeks worth of food now and can easily buy more nonperishables, but my main worry would be how to store water.

Is there some sort of app for prepper dating? I‚Äôm only half joking...that‚Äôs probably my best bet at survival tbh...
You‚Äôre right haha...but also I‚Äôm like ‚ÄúIF THIS HOW IT ENDS I CAN EAT WHATEVER TF I WANT NOW‚Äù

What happens when you get sick? I have symptoms of a cold (lol coronavirus??) and am wondering whether to continue IF, just not eat in general, or treat this like the end of days and just eat whatever the hell I want. Hmmm.
Hey wow almost exactly the same here! Monday will mark week three of IF at 1250 a day for me. WE GOT THIS.
Love it. Thanks!
This sounds stupid but can someone explain how......I want so badly to get to this one day but I swear sugar is an addiction for me

Breakfast is the best meal and it just so happens that I can get it all for free with the slim pickings I have at work. Oatmeal + banana/apple + 2 tbps peanut butter + cinnamon and I‚Äôm GUCCI. Sometimes I‚Äôll do granola + unsweetened almond milk + peanut butter if I‚Äôm feeling more texturally bored. Carbs and fats are *chefs kiss*

I‚Äôve been doing 16:8 for two weeks now and I feel great. I weigh myself every weekish and try to workout 3-4x a week. I think the biggest benefit has definitely been appetite control. I like to eat as soon as I am up and ready in the morning because breakfast is life amirite??? So it‚Äôll be like 8 am to 4 pm, which is really nice because I basically know that when I get home from work the kitchen is simply a place to prepare tomorrow‚Äôs lunch and drink water‚Äîno more agonizing over when or what to eat/snack on. 

It does get kind of tortuous to smell all the delicious home cooking my roommate does around dinner (right now my nostrils are grazing on a huge T-bone steak sizzling in butter and scallion pancakes from scratch being fried) but that‚Äôs how amazing IF has been for my appetite‚Äîall my senses are working, my stomach is even growling reflexively, and yet...I don‚Äôt feel...the hunger??

Brush your teeth, and just don‚Äôt buy snackable things and have them around. Or buy a self locking timer box to store your snacks in. Sometimes if I am having a sugar craving I‚Äôll drink hot water with a tsp of honey or snack on some fruit.
Omg this is SUCH a mood. Can‚Äôt wait to look unrecognizable and dye my hair to match üòçüòçüòç
Cool! Thanks

My practical side knew Ben had to die for the moral balance to be restored but damn if this isn‚Äôt a great ending that could‚Äôve been. :,) I also like that this would give closure to the whole thing that Finn was gonna tell Rey throughout the movie but never ended up saying (why did they create that unresolved tension??? It NIGGLES AT ME)? It could‚Äôve been his chance to really show and say his feelings in a dramatic way that would simultaneously ensure some degree of platonic love because it‚Äôs a sacrificial act?
Emailed as text in body of email. Reduce barriers to them reading your plea :)

Update: I found my LOCI lol. I sent Feb 20. Actually at the time I hadn‚Äôt even won the Gold Medal at the national level, just the Gold Key (state level) for A&W, which in my mind at least makes a huge difference. And for UChicago I hadn‚Äôt even mentioned the viewership and engagement stats the article I wrote received, which I had thought I did, because they were pretty substantial and a great quantified. Make of that what you will.

Again, this is all speculation. I think they would perhaps hold you to a slightly higher standard but that‚Äôs just my personal opinion. No need to worry extra about it. The whole process is a subjective crapshoot anyway. It sucks but try to keep in mind that whatever college you get into is no determination of your worth. I had friends get into Stanford and MIT but not University of Michigan Ross Pre-Admit, for example. It‚Äôs just so random sometimes.

Yes, you can add certifications as attachments! I don‚Äôt think I did for mine but it‚Äôs a good move to if you have it handy. 

Handwriting is kinda overkill imo, and if you mail a letter I would personally just be worried if it gets lost or whatever. In this digital age, email is probably better for peace of mind. I just sent an email.

There‚Äôs no quantitative proof for this but I would assume so, as you are essentially saying it‚Äôs your forte haha. I don‚Äôt think  the college app essay is necessarily the epitome of creativity though, since it should be rooted in autobiographical information, and is still somewhat formulaic. If anything, take comfort in the fact that you have a natural advantage! Some people really can‚Äôt write ;)

None‚ÄîI didn‚Äôt want to do management consulting. I‚Äôm at a smaller firm that is a leader in my field of interest. 

I honestly would not worry about positioning yourself for MBB as a high school senior lol. If you want to go into consulting majoring in Econ or a business-related field is probably a straight shot. But at Ivies almost any major can go into consulting, really (IR, Biology, Communications, Psych, etc). I was a consumer psych minor.
Hmmmm. Probably a relatively compelling LOCI then, avoiding excessive repetition of what they already know. Do you have a particular major or angle you‚Äôre applying with?
Not sure. I would suspect at the latest 2 weeks before RD announcements. You could ask, or perhaps some schools list a deadline?
Nope, working in consulting now. Wanted to study liberal arts but end up in business, which is what ended up happening!

I sort of angled for an English and Econ double major for both schools (although I would‚Äôve never done Econ if I had ended up attending UChicago, because it‚Äôs basically just a math major at that point, and I am allergic to math). I ended up being a Philosophy, Politics and Economics major at Penn because I wasn‚Äôt that interested in studying Shakespeare and figured I‚Äôd exercise my writing muscles by writing essays in the liberal arts anyhow. To be honest I still kind of wonder if I should‚Äôve majored in English and fulfilled my true artsy prophecy, but it would‚Äôve been too risky to go into business from that major, which is what I wanted to do and am now in.

Pretty average, probably an A- and a B+ in the mix. I updated my post with the full backstory of why I think I got in. I also remember at the time messaging people on CollegeConfidential threads from years back that had gotten in after deferral and being like HELP ME. One or two actually wrote back, surprisingly. I don‚Äôt remember what they said but it wasn‚Äôt anything truly surprising..

I was like:

1) thank you for your consideration
2) this really is my dream school (not a lie)
3) ~bit of pathos~ I really want to do more with my life beyond this depressing Michigan suburb 
4) Here are some accomplishments I‚Äôve achieved since I submitted my app

No more than a page long‚Äîkeep it short.
Just updated my post with stats and backstory! Hope that helps.

Took me a while to figure out what this stood for, but yea, I did! I just did some stalking online to find the email addresses of my regional admissions officers. Honestly if I can find it in my inbox I‚Äôll share with y‚Äôall.
I submitted a short portfolio of my creative writing when I applied!
Omg wow that gives me hope. Thanks! Yeah I guess it‚Äôs just sad to have a twig in the apt for half a year but I‚Äôll stick it out haha

Guys, thank you for all the upvotes and help! I will be monitoring carefully. Day 1 has passed and I think it‚Äôs uphill from here assuming they‚Äôre able to revert back to normal. 

I‚Äôm a first time plant parent and these were the two out of three plants I‚Äôve owned since September, so this has been a very sad setback. But I‚Äôm gonna keep plugging along as long as there‚Äôs hope!
Thanks haha. It was a 10 inch for $30 from TJMaxx, by a brand whose name I forget sadly. Do snag a pot stand duo whenever you see a decent price because I learned afterward they‚Äôre soooo expensive!
Damn. I just watered them this morning because the soil was dry and I read online they get dehydrated when cold because the cells shrink and it starves essentially. I panicked :(
Thanks ‚ù§Ô∏è

Sad...last time I bought them they were on flash sale! Might‚Äôve saved $1-3 on them each, which was incrementally more than the MUJI Week 10%. I think you can get 10% anytime by signing up for the newsletter?
INFJ 4w3. Shook!

Yes!! Been loving it more each year for all the reasons you mentioned, plus the festivity and warmth of the holidays. Coziness is a big factor too. I hate sweating in the summer and being harassed for wearing dresses. I do get SAD but oh well, summertime sadness exists too!
Interesting, why do you think that is?
Oooh this is good. I‚Äôm a 4w3 and this makes a lot of sense to me.

Haha, I get you. The descriptions for 4 can be a bit unflattering sometimes, like we‚Äôre pretentious bourgeoisie hipsters who only care about themselves. I mean, I got ‚ÄúThe Bohemian‚Äù (4w3) and I was like damn I ought to just move to Paris. But it‚Äôs true, I am melancholic and a bit overly dramatic sometimes, and that sort of wallowing does require a certain fixation with the self. 

I would say look for the traits in neutral descriptors. Aloneness is sometimes a fact more so than a feeling. I mean, we‚Äôre all inherently alone anyway, aren‚Äôt we? Perhaps 4s just live at a greater proximity to uncomfortable human truths. Then it becomes about transparency, authenticity, and even bravery, because it takes courage to be different.

The first time I reallllly felt understood was during the depths of high school teenage angst when I read an essay by George Orwell. That aside, I have 2-3 best friends that I think get me. My sister understands me intellectually and my mom is a good support even though she obviously comes from a different background than me. I think being understood has less to do with if the person can relate, and more to do with how empathetic, kind, and willing to just LISTEN they are. Though I‚Äôm a 4, I reject the notion that we‚Äôre doomed to feel forever ‚Äúmisunderstood‚Äù because we feel we‚Äôre so different. The world is pretty big and we‚Äôre always less alone than we think we are. That‚Äôs my two cents anyway!

Girl, I feel you. Graduated from college this year in May and let me tell you, there‚Äôs light at the end of the tunnel. I have a full time job I really like now and it‚Äôs just so much better than the isolation and crippling loneliness I felt in college. Not much has changed in terms of my friendships or relationships but I think sometimes college is just a toxic environment for some of us. Me being an introvert who wasn‚Äôt into drinking or drugs, it was hard. People in college are also just selfish and shallow as hell. Glad to be out and I think you will too. :)

Gosh, OP. This was really beautiful but also sad to read. 

Don‚Äôt worry, it‚Äôs out there for you too.
Update: It‚Äôs fixed! I guess drying it worked. Thanks all!
Thanks! Yeah, I tried looking for a user manual or something out there, but not much luck :(
So what I‚Äôm getting is that I ought to get a pot that‚Äôs 14 inch on top and 12 on the bottom (assuming I can‚Äôt find a straight cylinder)?
Thank you!! I had a pot question on my reply to another comment basically along the lines of: is a nursery pot that is 12 on top and 9.5 on bottom diameter sufficient?

Thank you so much for the input! I‚Äôm so glad I found this forum. I am taking your advice.

This is going to be the stupidest question, but the last one, I swear. I have begun looking into 12 in nursery pots for my baby and I‚Äôm coming across a LOT of pots that are wider on the top than on the bottom by a few inches. My current pot is 10 inches diameter top AND bottom (aka a straight cylinder) but all these new pots are like 12 inches by 9.5 inches. Isn‚Äôt that defeating the purpose if I actually decrease circumference at the bottom of the pot, where roots need most space to grow? But then will I overwhelm the plant if I get a 14 in pot so that it has 12 in of room at the bottom? Where do I find a normal pot?!
Dang it. The struggle continues! While I hunt for a larger nursery pot and decorative pot, do you recommend I water it frequently each time soil is dry?
Ok thanks! I watered it two days ago and tested it yesterday, and the meter said DRY again. Should I go ahead and rewater after just two days, or wait a few more?

Ok, thanks! Yeah, I‚Äôm just petrified of overwatering because it seems a harder problem to fix and more of a common mistake. But I guess I‚Äôve been really underwatering the poor guy, even as the weather gets colder?
Thanks! Yeah, it was the roots when I took it out of the pot. Ugh, why do big retailers sell plants to you exactly when they need to be repotted? Do you recommend a specific soil mix for repotting?

Thanks! I heard they like to be quite pot bound and to switch the pot when the roots start growing out of it. There‚Äôs a couple roots coiled at the top of the plant but I‚Äôm not sure if that‚Äôs considered growing out. Are there any risks to repotting if it‚Äôs not in fact ready?

I actually got a moisture meter as part of my attempt to diagnose! Was the driest at 1 and I watered it, but next day I tested soil again and it was dry at 1 again!? Am I watering wrong or not enough?

Me definitely. I don‚Äôt get panic attacks or anything, but just regular hopelessness and despair, almost daily tbh. I‚Äôve slowly come to realize that it tends to happen when I let myself have too much time to think (at night when I can‚Äôt fall asleep, in long car rides, when I‚Äôm bored and lonely) so I think the best solution for me has been to just fucking do something. I have a lot of hobbies actually but it‚Äôs just hard to keep them top of mind or overcome my natural malaise/laziness to do nothing. 

It‚Äôs a balance between productive healthy diversion (hobbies, improving skills, building yourself up as a human) and radical acceptance (agree with what a lot of others are saying about looking into Buddhism and spirituality stuff).

Lastly, I think it‚Äôs the most important for you to know that you are NOT alone in your crippling fear of loneliness (ironic, isn‚Äôt it?). Lots of INFJs like myself feel the same. We think and feel too much üòÇ Once I realized how the core meaning of being human was this horrible, hot loneliness that we all feel burning within‚Äîand that a lot of people fear it so much they don‚Äôt even put a name to it and spend their time pursuing more aggressive forms of escapism‚ÄîI felt more at ease. Everything is going through it. Not everyone is aware of it.
